channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for TN
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for TN

item.title: Report X-2024081275
item.description:
Report X-2024081275

Identified by scraper @ 2024-08-28T15:13:27+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-08-17
  • City: NASHVILLE
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 1
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Spill & Exposure. Hazmat. Leaking box, loss of 0.5 gal from 4x1gal plastic bottles Ecolab 6118111 Aqua Balance Muriatic Acid. Package Handler Essi Akota's leg was exposed and she felt a burning sensation while unloading. No further reaction to corrosive. Improper load orientation of the box on the bottom of wall in trailer FEDZ 557696 was noted; safety seals below caps corroded. 2 other boxes impacted by spill: TRK 278369646929 and 278010916733. Please see attached scan of Hazmat Incident Form completed at time of incident.

The metal drum hit the edge of the catwalk causing a puncture near the bottom chime. The contents were placed into a steel salvage package and will be disposed of as hazardous material.

item.title: Report X-2024081570
item.description:
Report X-2024081570

Identified by scraper @ 2024-08-26T06:17:30+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-08-22
  • City: KINGSPORT
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: This package was found on a trailer during the unload process. The package was visibly wet. Upon inspection I found 4 one gallon jugs of Reagent Alcohol which all had lids that were tightened down and all containers were in good condition. 1 of the 4 containers visibly had less contents than the other 3. The reason for damage is unknown. It is unknown how the package failed and what failed on the package.

item.title: Report X-2024080640
item.description:
Report X-2024080640

Identified by scraper @ 2024-08-22T18:16:06+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-08-06
  • City: NASHVILLE
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 1
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Spill & exposure. Leaking box. One of 4x64oz plastic bottles Santeen Drain Cleaner lost 36oz from severe denting & loose cap closure. Spill occurred in spite of tape around caps & slotted partitions. Exposure: Package handler Jason Bowers, was exposed (skin contact on hands, no spotting or staining. Spillage released heat.) when attempting to remove package from IC belt. Package Handler Trainer Justin Hoeh had minor corrosion to undersides of shoes. Upon recommendation of Hoeh and Hall (DGNav reporter), the Work Area Manager ensured Bowers rinsed his hands for 10-15 min and continued follow up. Safety specialists have been notified.
